result.execSummary:
The defendant Yanira E Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50  per month.  3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yanira E Rivera

Plea - G
BTC: GUILTY.

Defendant Yanira E Rivera in court.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is prepared to proceed.
The Court conducts the plea colloquy.
The deft will now like to look into getting an atty.
BTC: Matter adjourned,  Attorney information given to defendant.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
Status conference on October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 3, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Yanira E Rivera in court.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
